title: How to Make Edamame Salad with Wasabi Dressing

steps.headline: Cook the edamame.
steps.description: Prepare them either in the microwave or over the stove top. Microwave: Combine them with 2 tablespoons of water in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the edamame on "high" for about 6 to 8 minutes. Shock them in an ice water bowl for a few minutes and completely drain. Stove top: Combine them with about 1/2 cup of water in a small pot. Heat the edamame over a medium high heat for about 5 to 7 minutes. Shock them in an ice water bowl for a few minutes and completely drain.

steps.headline: Combine the salad ingredients.
steps.description: Allow the edamame to completely cool to the touch. Add all the salad ingredients together in a medium bowl.

steps.headline: Make the dressing.
steps.description: Mix the wasabi, salad dressing, and soy sauce together in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Finish the salad.
steps.description: Drizzle the salad dressing over the edamame salad. Toss the ingredients, so everything coats thoroughly.

text: Cook the edamame. Prepare them either in the microwave or over the stove top. Microwave: Combine them with 2 tablespoons of water in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat the edamame on "high" for about 6 to 8 minutes. Shock them in an ice water bowl for a few minutes and completely drain. Stove top: Combine them with about 1/2 cup of water in a small pot. Heat the edamame over a medium high heat for about 5 to 7 minutes. Shock them in an ice water bowl for a few minutes and completely drain. Combine the salad ingredients. Allow the edamame to completely cool to the touch. Add all the salad ingredients together in a medium bowl. Make the dressing. Mix the wasabi, salad dressing, and soy sauce together in a small bowl. Finish the salad. Drizzle the salad dressing over the edamame salad. Toss the ingredients, so everything coats thoroughly. Finished.
